Perceptor/Hydras:

Perceptor Moved to Medical Bay, and he could sense that =
Hydras was there waitting them. They moved to one of the rooms, and waited =
to Rodimus and the gravity cart to arrive. Hydras smiled and looking to Per=
ceptor said "So what's your teory, Perceptor"

"Some organics creatures, ad=
opt as parents the first moving thing that moves in front  of the new born"=
said the male"According with the data gatered by Rodimus, this lady had dam=
aged her identity circuits; she didnt know if she was predacon or Maximal, =
when she emerged from her pod she could have become either Maximal or preda=
con, but... She woke up in a maximal base, sorrounded and cared by Maximals=
; then she adopted the ways of a maximal... with my program all those memor=
ies are surpresed and her maximal program contained... We need to create a =
bond with predacons before attempt a radical reprogramation"

"And that mea=
ns that she have to be cared by predacons" said Hydras with a slight laught=
 "I know that you are volenteer for the task but the other members of the c=
rew? By the pit, i dont think so... Zarak and Scorponok tend to double cros=
s, Scourge and Cyclonus are new and i dont sure if they could be a good nan=
nies... or want the task; humm" 

Then looked for Rodimus he said "Perhap, =
You Rodimus could assit Perceptor, when your main obligation allowed to do =
it" 


From: Preston Carroll 
Sent: Friday, March 12, 2010 5:52 AM
To: nbwr=
pg@yahoogroups.com 
Subject: Re: Recovering Rodimus/BlackFortress


  
> "T=
hat depends of her"said the male while he started to untied her wrists and =
ankles, her wrists, altought healed,  they slighty showed the marks of all =
treatment that she had suffred as POW "Help me to lay her in the anti-gravi=
ty cart, we need to take her to medical bay, Hydras is waitting us there; i=
f all is according with the plan, when she wake up she wont remember anythi=
ng and she will have an neutral aligement... And dont be nervous, she wont =
bite you.."

Rodimus nodded once again as he helped Perceptor move Nightlig=
ht to
the cart. "Maybe that's best." Rodimus said, his voice resuming its
n=
ormal tones and his face clearing a bit. At the stating of Hydras'
name Rod=
imus had became visibly calmer. After all, he trusted Hydras
implicitly, an=
d he knew that all would go well. Rodimus was not sure
'why' he trusted Hyd=
ras so much, but he did.

> Perceptor did a last scan and dryly said "She's=
 ready to move, let's go to Medical bay"

"Good" Rodimus said as he began t=
o push the cart in the direction of
the medical bay.

(TAG)

Preston
